<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/531be47ac5522807b265c6287021a01c9b895ac9|patch 8.2.1736: failure to compile a pattern not tested much>
patch 8.2.1736: failure to compile a pattern not tested much

Problem:    Failure to compile a pattern not tested much.
Solution:   Add tests where a pattern fails to compile. (Yegappan Lakshmanan,
            closes #7004)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1736: failure to compile a pattern not tested much · vim/vim@531be47
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1736: failure to compile a pattern not tested much · vim/vim@531be47
attachments.text: Problem: Failure to compile a pattern not tested much. Solution: Add tests where a pattern fails to compile. (Yegappan Lakshmanan, closes #7004)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/851d108313317a062371a6750e6c6bf370a9bafa|patch 8.2.1735: Github actions appear to timeout too soon>
patch 8.2.1735: Github actions appear to timeout too soon

Problem:    Github actions appear to timeout too soon.
Solution:   use "timeout" instead of "ping".

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1735: Github actions appear to timeout too soon · vim/vim@851d108
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1735: Github actions appear to timeout too soon · vim/vim@851d108
attachments.text: Problem: Github actions appear to timeout too soon. Solution: use "timeout" instead of "ping".

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/148ce7ae62e92ecf6487a4ba5902ddb7e699074b|patch 8.2.1734: Vim9: cannot use a funcref for a closure twice>
patch 8.2.1734: Vim9: cannot use a funcref for a closure twice

Problem:    Vim9: cannot use a funcref for a closure twice.
Solution:   Instead of putting the funcref on the stack use a growarray on the
            execution context.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1734: Vim9: cannot use a funcref for a closure twice · vim/vim@148ce7a
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1734: Vim9: cannot use a funcref for a closure twice · vim/vim@148ce7a
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: cannot use a funcref for a closure twice. Solution: Instead of putting the funcref on the stack use a growarray on the execution context.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/4ee711f21389066fa157961feed17692fc16bf8e|patch 8.2.1733: Vim9: memory leaks when using nested function>
patch 8.2.1733: Vim9: memory leaks when using nested function

Problem:    Vim9: memory leaks when using nested function.
Solution:   Free function when compilation fails.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1733: Vim9: memory leaks when using nested function · vim/vim@4ee711f
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1733: Vim9: memory leaks when using nested function · vim/vim@4ee711f
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: memory leaks when using nested function. Solution: Free function when compilation fails.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/6bf1b52ba2816dffdbd0d994320abfb1586bf666|patch 8.2.1732: stuck when win_execute() for a popup causes an error>
patch 8.2.1732: stuck when win_execute() for a popup causes an error

Problem:    Stuck when win_execute() for a popup causes an error.
Solution:   Disable the filter callback on error. (issue #6999)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1732: stuck when win_execute() for a popup causes an error · vim/vim@6bf1b52
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1732: stuck when win_execute() for a popup causes an error · vim/vim@6bf1b52
attachments.text: Problem: Stuck when win_execute() for a popup causes an error. Solution: Disable the filter callback on error. (issue #6999)
